intro: Koanophyllon cubense, commonly known as the Cuban blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small blue or purple flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
